ground_truth: Michael slowly turns around, and Estevez rushes in to restrain Michael, grabbing his wrist with fingers tightening. In an instant, Michael moves like a blur, breaking the cop's arm and spinning him around to use as a human shield. Michael takes charge, holding a gun to Estevez's head and facing off with Burton as the street lamps begin to flicker and strobe, adding to the confusion. Burton squeezes his eyes shut in pain, his whole body quaking, and heels clicking the pavement, like some massive pressure is building inside him. His eyes snap open, focused, as the force inside him now takes control. Estevez looks at his partner with confusion, but Michael seems to know exactly who he's talking to. BLAM! Burton shoots his partner in the head, Estevez drops, leaving Michael without cover. Burton re-aims, but Michael is faster, already firing back. Bullets rip up the concrete. SMASH! The squad car window shatters, Burton's chest explodes, and he goes down, leaving Michael the only one left standing. Smoke rises from his gun. With soldier-like efficiency, Michael picks up the rifle bags and loads them into the trunk of the squad car. He gets in the car and floors it, roaring away as the flickering street lamps finally go out in rapid succession, a wave chasing him and plunging the entire city into darkness. Jeep bolts awake, breathing hard and covered with sweat. He switches on a lamp, illuminating his incredibly cramped bedroom. He's got shaggy hair and a sensitive face, seemingly not fond of sunlight. A couple of ancient Silverstream trailers are bathed in the eerie blue light of night's final moments, looking like they haven't moved from this barren ground in decades. A single strand of colored Christmas lights dots the trailers' roof lines, marking the season. One of the trailer doors creaks open, and Jeep steps wearily out into the cool western morning. He gazes up to the diner's slanted roof where a large sign glows like a beacon in the darkness. He pauses, contemplating the sign, and then turns to see Charlie, a very pregnant girl about twenty, standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the sleep from her eyes. She approaches Jeep, sees the strain in his eyes, and he struggles for a moment before nodding. A glimmer of a smile crosses Jeep's face, but he turns away, dejected. Charlie smiles sadly at him, touched by his sweetness, but she isn't on the same page. Jeep nods, trying to hide the fact that he's hurting inside. Bob Hansen, the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment, attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Michael gradually rotates around, and Estevez dashes in to constrain Michael, clutching his wrist with digits tightening. In an instant, Michael moves like a blur, fracturing the officer's limb and twirling him around to use as a human barrier. Michael takes command, holding a firearm to Estevez's head and confronting Burton as the street lamps start to flicker and strobe, adding to the chaos. Burton clenches his eyes shut in agony, his entire body trembling, and heels tapping the pavement, as if some immense pressure is building inside him. His eyes snap open, concentrated, as the force inside him now assumes control. Estevez glances at his partner with bewilderment, but Michael seems to understand exactly who he's addressing. BLAM! Burton shoots his partner in the head, Estevez falls, leaving Michael without protection. Burton re-aims, but Michael is quicker, already firing back. Bullets tear up the concrete. SMASH! The patrol car window breaks, Burton's chest detonates, and he collapses, leaving Michael the only one remaining upright. Smoke rises from his gun. With soldierly precision, Michael retrieves the rifle bags and loads them into the trunk of the patrol car. He enters the car and accelerates, roaring away as the flickering street lamps finally extinguish in rapid succession, a wave pursuing him and casting the entire city into darkness. Jeep starts awake, breathing heavily and covered with perspiration. He switches on a lamp, illuminating his incredibly cramped bedroom. He's got unkempt hair and a sensitive face, seemingly not fond of sunlight. A couple of ancient Silverstream trailers are bathed in the eerie blue light of night's final moments, appearing as if they haven't moved from this barren ground in decades. A single strand of colorful Christmas lights dots the trailers' roof lines, marking the season. One of the trailer doors creaks open, and Jeep steps wearily out into the cool western morning. He gazes up to the diner's slanted roof where a large sign glows like a beacon in the darkness. He pauses, contemplating the sign, and then turns to see Charlie, a very pregnant girl about twenty, standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the sleep from her eyes. She approaches Jeep, sees the strain in his eyes, and he struggles for a moment before nodding. A glimmer of a smile crosses Jeep's face, but he turns away, dejected. Charlie smiles sadly at him, touched by his sweetness, but she isn't on the same page. Jeep nods, trying to hide the fact that he's hurting inside. Bob Hansen, the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment, attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description:
Michael was slowly turned around, and Estevez rushed in to be restrained by Michael, whose wrist was grabbed with fingers tightening. In an instant, like a blur, the cop's arm was broken by Michael, who spun him around to be used as a human shield. The charge was taken by Michael, who held a gun to Estevez's head and faced off with Burton as the street lamps began to flicker and strobe, adding to the confusion. Burton's eyes were squeezed shut in pain, his whole body quaking, and the pavement was clicked by his heels, as if some massive pressure was being built inside him. His eyes snapped open, focused, as the force inside him was now in control. Estevez looked at his partner with confusion, but the identity of the one being spoken to was known exactly by Michael. BLAM! His partner was shot in the head by Burton, and Estevez was dropped, leaving Michael without cover. Burton re-aimed, but he was outpaced by Michael, already firing back. The concrete was ripped up by bullets. SMASH! The squad car window was shattered, Burton's chest exploded, and he was brought down, leaving Michael the only one left standing. Smoke was rising from his gun. With soldier-like efficiency, the rifle bags were picked up by Michael and loaded into the trunk of the squad car. The car was entered by him, and it was floored, roaring away as the flickering street lamps finally went out in rapid succession, a wave chasing him and plunging the entire city into darkness. 

Jeep bolted awake, breathing hard and covered with sweat. A lamp was switched on by him, illuminating his incredibly cramped bedroom. His hair was shaggy and his face sensitive, seemingly not fond of sunlight. A couple of ancient Silverstream trailers were bathed in the eerie blue light of night's final moments, looking like they hadn't moved from this barren ground in decades. The roof lines of the trailers were dotted by a single strand of colored Christmas lights, marking the season. One of the trailer doors was creaked open, and Jeep stepped wearily out into the cool western morning. He gazed up at the diner's slanted roof where a large sign glowed like a beacon in the darkness. A pause was made by him, contemplating the sign, and then he turned to see Charlie, a very pregnant girl about twenty, standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing sleep from her eyes. She approached Jeep, saw the strain in his eyes, and a struggle was experienced by him for a moment before nodding. A glimmer of a smile was crossed by Jeep's face, but he turned away, dejected. Charlie smiled sadly at him, touched by his sweetness, but she wasn't on the same page. A nod was given by Jeep, trying to hide the fact that inside he was hurting. Bob Hansen, the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment, fixed the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Michael turns around as Estevez rushes in, restraining him with a firm grip. Instantly, Michael moves swiftly, breaking Estevez's arm and using him as a shield. He holds a gun to Estevez's head, facing Burton as street lamps flicker. Burton, in pain, feels pressure building inside him. His eyes refocus as the force takes over. Estevez is confused, but Michael understands. BLAM! Burton shoots Estevez, leaving Michael exposed. Burton re-aims, but Michael fires first. Bullets hit the concrete. SMASH! The squad car window shatters, Burton is hit, and falls. Smoke rises from Michael's gun. Efficiently, he loads rifle bags into the squad car and speeds off as the street lamps go out, plunging the city into darkness. Jeep wakes up, sweating and breathing hard. He turns on a lamp, lighting his cramped room. His shaggy hair and sensitive face suggest he dislikes sunlight. Old Silverstream trailers sit untouched for decades, illuminated by blue dawn light and dotted with Christmas lights. Jeep steps out into the cool morning, gazing at a large diner sign glowing in the darkness. He turns to see Charlie, a pregnant girl, in the trailer doorway. She approaches, seeing Jeep’s strained expression as he struggles before nodding. A fleeting smile crosses his face, but he turns away. Charlie, touched by his sweetness, smiles sadly back. Jeep nods, hiding his hurt. Bob Hansen, the roadside diner owner, tries to fix the old TV by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Michael turns as Estevez rushes to restrain him, grabbing his wrist tightly. Instantly, Michael breaks Estevez's arm, using him as a shield. Michael holds a gun to Estevez's head, facing off with Burton as street lamps flicker. Burton shuts his eyes, body quaking, then opens them focused, a force controlling him. Estevez looks confused, but Michael is aware. BLAM! Burton shoots Estevez, leaving Michael exposed. Burton re-aims, but Michael shoots first. Bullets fly, shattering the squad car window as Burton falls. Michael, left standing, loads rifle bags into the car and drives off, street lamps darkening behind him. Jeep awakens, sweaty and breathing hard, in his cramped bedroom. Shaggy-haired, he dislikes sunlight. A couple of ancient Silverstream trailers, marked by Christmas lights, sit unmoved. Jeep steps into the cool morning, gazing at a diner sign glowing in the darkness. Charlie, a pregnant girl of about twenty, appears, rubbing her eyes. She sees Jeep's strain, and he nods, masking his pain. Jeep turns away, dejected, as Charlie smiles sadly. Bob Hansen, owner of the roadside establishment, tries to fix an old TV by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Michael, with a deliberate and cautious motion, slowly turns around to face the situation, while Estevez charges in with a sense of urgency, quickly reaching out to restrain Michael by gripping his wrist tightly with fingers that constrict like a vice. In the blink of an eye, Michael's movements become lightning-fast, almost a blur of motion; he swiftly breaks the officer’s arm and spins him around, skillfully using him as a human shield. With commanding presence, Michael takes control of the situation by holding a gun to Estevez’s head and facing off with Burton. The street lamps begin to flicker and strobe erratically, intensifying the chaos of the moment. Burton squeezes his eyes shut, overwhelmed by pain, his entire body trembling violently as his heels click against the pavement, as if an enormous internal pressure is building within him. His eyes suddenly snap open, sharply focused, as the force inside him seizes control. Estevez glances at his partner with a look of bewilderment, but Michael appears to comprehend precisely who he is dealing with. BLAM! Burton fires a shot at his partner's head, causing Estevez to collapse, leaving Michael exposed with no cover. Burton quickly re-aims, but Michael proves to be faster, already returning fire with precision. Bullets tear through the concrete, ripping it to shreds. SMASH! The window of the squad car shatters explosively, and Burton’s chest erupts with the impact, sending him crashing to the ground, leaving Michael as the sole survivor standing. Smoke curls up from the barrel of his gun. With the efficiency of a seasoned soldier, Michael gathers up the rifle bags and loads them into the trunk of the squad car. He climbs into the vehicle and slams the accelerator, roaring away down the street as the flickering street lamps finally extinguish in rapid succession, a wave of darkness chasing him, engulfing the entire city in an impenetrable cloak of blackness. Jeep bolts awake suddenly, breathing hard, drenched in sweat. He switches on a bedside lamp, casting a warm glow over his incredibly cramped bedroom. His hair is shaggy, and his face is sensitive, as if he has a natural aversion to sunlight. Nearby, a couple of ancient Silverstream trailers are bathed in the eerie, bluish light of the night’s final moments, appearing as though they haven't moved from this desolate, barren ground in decades. A single strand of colorful Christmas lights decorates the trailers’ rooflines, marking the festive season. The creaky door of one trailer slowly opens with a groan, and Jeep steps out wearily into the crisp, cool air of the western morning. He gazes upward at the slanted roof of a nearby diner, where a large sign glows like a beacon cutting through the surrounding darkness. He pauses momentarily, contemplating the sign, before turning to notice Charlie, a visibly pregnant young woman, around twenty years old, standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the remnants of sleep from her eyes. She approaches Jeep, noticing the strain reflected in his eyes; he struggles to maintain his composure for a moment before nodding affirmatively. A faint glimmer of a smile briefly crosses Jeep’s face, but he turns away, visibly dejected. Charlie offers him a sad smile, touched by his tender sweetness, yet not on the same emotional wavelength. Jeep nods in understanding, attempting to conceal the fact that he is hurting inside. Meanwhile, Bob Hansen, the owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment, who appears to be in his late 40s, busies himself trying to fix the old TV that hangs in the corner above the counter by resorting to giving it a series of firm bangs.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a deliberate and cautious motion, Michael turns around slowly, taking his time to face the situation unfolding before him. Estevez, however, charges in with a palpable sense of urgency, quickly reaching out in an attempt to restrain Michael, gripping his wrist tightly with fingers that clamp down like a vice grip. In the blink of an eye, Michael's movements become almost lightning-fast, transforming into a blur of motion as he swiftly breaks the officer’s arm and spins him around, skillfully using him as a human shield. Demonstrating a commanding presence, Michael takes control of the situation by holding a gun to Estevez’s head, facing off with Burton. The street lamps overhead begin to flicker and strobe erratically, adding an intense layer to the chaos of the moment. Burton squeezes his eyes shut, overwhelmed by a sharp sensation of pain; his entire body starts trembling violently, his heels clicking against the pavement, as if an enormous internal pressure is building up within him. His eyes suddenly snap open, sharply focused, as the force inside him takes over with a fierce intensity. Estevez glances at his partner with a look of complete bewilderment, but Michael seems to comprehend precisely who he is dealing with in that tense moment. BLAM! Burton fires a shot at his partner's head, causing Estevez to collapse to the ground, leaving Michael exposed without any cover. Burton quickly re-aims, but Michael proves faster and more precise, already returning fire with unerring accuracy. Bullets tear through the concrete, ripping it apart and sending debris flying everywhere. SMASH! The window of the squad car shatters explosively, and Burton’s chest erupts with the impact, sending him crashing to the ground, leaving Michael as the only survivor standing amidst the chaos. Smoke curls up from the barrel of his gun, a thin wisp trailing upward. With the efficiency and precision of a seasoned soldier, Michael gathers up the rifle bags and diligently loads them into the trunk of the squad car. He climbs into the vehicle, slams the accelerator, and roars away down the street as the flickering street lamps finally extinguish in rapid succession, a wave of darkness chasing him, engulfing the entire city in an impenetrable cloak of blackness. Jeep bolts awake suddenly, breathing hard and drenched in sweat. He reaches over and switches on a bedside lamp, casting a warm, soothing glow over his incredibly cramped bedroom. His hair is shaggy and unruly, and his face is sensitive, as though he has a natural aversion to sunlight. Nearby, a couple of ancient Silverstream trailers are bathed in the eerie, bluish light of the night's final moments, appearing as though they haven't moved from this desolate, barren ground in decades. A single strand of colorful Christmas lights decorates the trailers’ rooflines, marking the festive season with a hint of cheer. The creaky door of one trailer slowly opens with an audible groan, and Jeep steps out wearily into the crisp, cool air of the western morning. He gazes upward at the slanted roof of a nearby diner, where a large sign glows brightly like a beacon, slicing through the surrounding darkness. He pauses momentarily to contemplate the sign before turning to notice Charlie, a visibly pregnant young woman, around twenty years old, standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the remnants of sleep from her eyes. She approaches Jeep, noticing the strain reflected in his eyes; he struggles to maintain his composure for a moment before nodding affirmatively. A faint glimmer of a smile briefly crosses Jeep’s face, but he turns away, clearly dejected by something deep within. Charlie offers him a sad smile, touched by his tender sweetness, yet not quite sharing the same emotional wavelength. Jeep nods in understanding, attempting to conceal the fact that he is hurting on the inside. In the meantime, Bob Hansen, the owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment, who appears to be in his late 40s, busies himself with trying to fix the old TV that hangs in the corner above the counter by resorting to giving it a series of firm bangs in hopes of reviving it.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Michael begins by slowly turning his body around, aware of his surroundings, when suddenly, Estevez charges forward with determination and urgency, reaching out and grasping Michael's wrist with a firm, tightening grip. In a split-second reaction, Michael becomes a whirlwind of movement, swiftly breaking free and snapping the cop's arm while simultaneously twisting Estevez's body around to position him as a human shield. With precision and control, Michael seizes the opportunity to take command of the situation, pressing a gun against Estevez's head as he stands off against Burton. All around them, the street lamps start to flicker and strobe erratically, casting a disorienting shadow over the tense standoff. Meanwhile, Burton, overwhelmed by a mysterious, growing force inside him, squeezes his eyes shut, grimacing in pain. His entire body quivers, and his heels click against the pavement as if he is trying to resist some immense pressure. Suddenly, his eyes snap open, now sharp and focused, as he succumbs to the overpowering force within him. Estevez, still caught in Michael's grip, darts a look of bewilderment at his partner, but Michael remains unfazed, seemingly understanding the unspoken exchange with Burton. In a shocking twist, Burton pulls the trigger, firing a shot that fatally strikes Estevez in the head, causing him to collapse to the ground and leaving Michael without his protective barrier. Burton attempts to aim again, but Michael is quicker, his instincts honed, and he fires back. The concrete around them erupts as bullets strike the ground, and with the sound of shattering glass, the squad car window explodes, Burton's chest bursts open, and he falls, leaving Michael the last man standing amid the chaos. Smoke lazily rises from Michael's gun, evidence of the recent gunfire, and displaying a soldier-like focus and speed, he gathers the rifle bags, swiftly loading them into the trunk of the nearby squad car. He climbs into the driver's seat, slams the door shut, and with a forceful press of the gas pedal, the car accelerates, wheels screeching as it disappears down the street. The erratic street lamps give one last flicker before a cascading wave of darkness overtakes them, plunging the whole city into blackness as the car speeds away. Meanwhile, Jeep awakens abruptly, jolting upright in his bed, his breathing ragged and skin damp with sweat as he struggles to shake off the remnants of a nightmare. With trembling fingers, he switches on a lamp that casts light over the cramped confines of his small bedroom, revealing his shaggy hair and a sensitive face that seems to shun the daylight. Outside, a couple of old Silverstream trailers sit under the dim, eerie blue glow of the pre-dawn moments, appearing as though they've remained stationary on this desolate patch of land for decades. A whimsical line of colored Christmas lights, a nod to the holiday season, decorates the rooflines of the trailers. One of the trailer doors creaks open with age, and Jeep steps out into the cool, early morning air of the west, looking up at the diner's slanted roof where a large, luminous sign stands out against the dark. He pauses, deep in thought, while regarding the sign before turning his gaze to Charlie, a very pregnant young woman of about twenty years old, who is standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing sleep from her eyes. She approaches Jeep, noticing the strain etched on his face, and despite his internal struggle, he manages a nod in acknowledgment. For a brief moment, a faint smile tugs at Jeep's lips, although he turns away, his expression turning somber with inner turmoil. Charlie offers him a sad smile in return, touched by the gentle nature she perceives in him, yet she remains emotionally distant, not quite sharing his perspective. Jeep nods again, attempting to mask the emotional pain he feels, while Bob Hansen, a man in his late forties and the owner of the nearby roadside diner, busies himself with trying to repair the old TV hanging precariously in the corner above the counter, resorting to banging on it in the hope of coaxing it back to life.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Michael swiftly turns and subdues Estevez, using him as a human shield while facing Burton. As the street lamps flicker, Burton struggles internally, succumbing to a powerful force that leads him to shoot Estevez, leaving Michael exposed. In the ensuing gunfight, Michael fatally wounds Burton, leaving him as the last one standing. Michael then efficiently gathers rifle bags, loads them into the squad car, and drives off as the city's lights extinguish behind him.

Meanwhile, Jeep awakens abruptly in his cramped bedroom, switches on a lamp, and steps out into the cool morning. He takes a moment to contemplate a glowing sign atop the diner's roof before noticing Charlie, a pregnant young woman. They exchange looks, and though Jeep tries to mask his emotions, Charlie senses his inner struggle. Jeep nods in acknowledgment, turning away with unspoken feelings. Meanwhile, Bob Hansen, the diner owner, attempts to fix an old TV by giving it a firm tap.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
Michael slowly turns around as Estevez, a veteran police officer known for his quick reflexes, rushes in to restrain Michael, grabbing his wrist with fingers tightening. In an instant, Michael, trained in an advanced martial art, moves like a blur, breaking the cop's arm and spinning him around to use as a human shield. Michael takes charge, holding a gun to Estevez's head and facing off with Burton. The street lamps, relics from a bygone era, begin to flicker and strobe, adding to the confusion. Burton squeezes his eyes shut in pain, his whole body quaking, and heels clicking the pavement, like some massive pressure is building inside him, reminiscent of stories about those with latent powers. His eyes snap open, focused, as the force inside him now takes control. Estevez looks at his partner with confusion, but Michael seems to know exactly who he's talking to, aware of Burton's peculiar abilities. BLAM! Burton, under some unseen influence, shoots his partner in the head; Estevez drops, leaving Michael without cover. Burton re-aims, but Michael is faster, already firing back. Bullets rip up the concrete. SMASH! The squad car window shatters, Burton's chest explodes, and he goes down, leaving Michael the only one left standing. Smoke rises from his gun. With soldier-like efficiency, Michael picks up the rifle bags, packed for a high-stakes mission, and loads them into the trunk of the squad car. He gets in the car and floors it, roaring away as the flickering street lamps finally go out in rapid succession, a wave chasing him and plunging the entire city into darkness.

Jeep bolts awake, breathing hard and covered with sweat, haunted by the vivid dreams he cannot explain. He switches on a lamp, illuminating his incredibly cramped bedroom, filled with memorabilia of the past. He’s got shaggy hair and a sensitive face, seemingly not fond of sunlight, preferring the quiet of pre-dawn. A couple of ancient Silverstream trailers are bathed in the eerie blue light of night's final moments, looking like they haven't moved from this barren ground in decades, remnants of a once lively trailer park. A single strand of colored Christmas lights dots the trailers' roof lines, a modest attempt to mark the season. One of the trailer doors creaks open, and Jeep steps wearily out into the cool western morning, where the desert air greets him. He gazes up to the diner's slanted roof where a large sign glows like a beacon in the darkness, a symbol of hope for travelers. He pauses, contemplating the sign, and then turns to see Charlie, a very pregnant girl about twenty, standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the sleep from her eyes, a stark reminder of their shared reality. She approaches Jeep, sees the strain in his eyes, and he struggles for a moment before nodding. A glimmer of a smile crosses Jeep's face, but he turns away, dejected by the unspoken distance between them. Charlie smiles sadly at him, touched by his sweetness, but she isn't on the same page, perhaps thinking of the uncertain future. Jeep nods, trying to hide the fact that he's hurting inside. Bob Hansen, the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment, known for his innovative yet frugal repairs, attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it, a common resort of his when technology fails.

On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. He gets in the car and floors it roaring away as the flickering street lamps finally go out in rapid succession a wave chasing him and plunging the entire city into darkness. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. He gets in the car and floors it roaring away as the flickering street lamps finally go out in rapid succession a wave chasing him and plunging the entire city into darkness. Jeep bolts awake breathing hard and covered with sweat. He switches on a lamp illuminating his incredibly cramped bedroom. He is got shaggy hair and a sensitive face seemingly not fond of sunlight. A couple of ancient Silverstream trailers are bathed in the eerie blue light of night's final moments looking like they have not moved from this barren ground in decades. A single strand of colored Christmas lights dots the trailers' roof lines marking the season. One of the trailer doors creaks open and Jeep steps wearily out into the cool western morning. He gazes up to the diner's slanted roof where a large sign glows like a beacon in the darkness. He pauses contemplating the sign and then turns to see Charlie a very pregnant girl about twenty standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the sleep from her eyes. She approaches. Jeep sees the strain in his eyes and he struggles for a moment before nodding. A glimmer of a smile crosses Jeep's face but he turns away dejected. Charlie smiles sadly at him touched by his sweetness but she is not on the same page. Jeep nods trying to hide the fact that he is hurting inside. Bob Hansen the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Michael slowly turns around and Estevez rushes in to restrain Michael grabbing his wrist with fingers tightening. In an instant Michael moves like a blur breaking the cop's arm and spinning him around to use as a human shield. Michael takes charge holding a gun to Estevez's head and facing off with Burton as the street lamps begin to flicker and strobe adding to the confusion. Burton squeezes his eyes shut in pain his whole body quaking and heels clicking the pavement like some massive pressure is building inside him. His eyes snap open focused as the force inside him now takes control. Estevez looks at his partner with confusion but Michael seems to know exactly who he is talking to. BLAM. Burton shoots his partner in the head. He pauses contemplating the sign and then turns to see Charlie a very pregnant girl about twenty standing in the trailer doorway and rubbing the sleep from her eyes. She approaches. Jeep sees the strain in his eyes and he struggles for a moment before nodding. A glimmer of a smile crosses Jeep's face but he turns away dejected. Charlie smiles sadly at him touched by his sweetness but she is not on the same page. Jeep nods trying to hide the fact that he is hurting inside. Bob Hansen the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it.

Michael takes charge holding a gun to Estevez's head and facing off with Burton as the street lamps begin to flicker and strobe adding to the confusion. Charlie smiles sadly at him touched by his sweetness but she is not on the same page. Jeep nods trying to hide the fact that he is hurting inside. Bob Hansen the late 40s owner and proprietor of this roadside establishment attempts to fix the old TV hanging in the corner above the counter by banging on it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Jonathan swiftly pivots, and Ramirez leaps in to restrain Jonathan, clutching his elbow with knuckles tightening. In a heartbeat, Jonathan darts like the wind, snapping the chef's spatula and twirling him around to use as a cardboard shield. Jonathan seizes control, pointing a pen to Ramirez's ear and confronting Thompson as the street artists start to flicker and spin, adding to the chaos. Thompson closes his eyes in discomfort, his entire form trembling, and soles tapping the gravel, like some colossal tension is building within him. His eyes fly open, sharp, as the energy within him now commands. Ramirez stares at his colleague with bewilderment, but Jonathan appears to know exactly who he's confronting. BAM! Thompson throws his teammate in the face, Ramirez tumbles, leaving Jonathan without protection. Thompson adjusts his throw, but Jonathan is quicker, already tossing back. Pebbles tear up the soil. CRASH! The vending machine window disintegrates, Thompson's torso implodes, and he collapses, leaving Jonathan the sole figure standing. Fog rises from his pen. With hunter-like precision, Jonathan gathers the backpack bundles and stows them into the trunk of the vending machine. He climbs into the machine and accelerates, thundering away as the spinning street artists finally cease in swift sequence, a rush tailing him and casting the entire village into shadow. Racer jerks alert, panting heavily and drenched with perspiration. He flicks on a candle, illuminating his remarkably tight attic. He's got unruly hair and a thoughtful visage, seemingly not keen on dawn. A couple of antique campers are washed in the haunting azure glow of night's closing moments, appearing as though they haven't shifted from this desolate terrain in eons. A single string of vibrant festival lights adorns the campers' rooflines, heralding the occasion. One of the camper doors groans ajar, and Racer steps reluctantly out into the crisp eastern morning. He stares up to the library's tilted roof where a broad billboard glows like a lighthouse in the gloom. He hesitates, pondering the billboard, and then turns to see Casey, a quite expectant woman approximately twenty, standing in the camper threshold and wiping the drowsiness from her features. She approaches Racer, perceives the tension in his gaze, and he struggles momentarily before agreeing. A flicker of a grin passes Racer's lips, but he turns aside, disheartened. Casey grins wistfully at him, moved by his warmth, but she isn't aligned. Racer agrees, trying to mask the fact that he's aching internally. Tom Wilson, the middle-aged custodian and overseer of this highway stop, endeavors to repair the aged radio hanging in the nook above the buffet by thumping on it.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Michael, restrained by Estevez, quickly turns the tables, breaking his arm and using him as a shield. Facing off with Burton amidst flickering street lamps, Michael gains the upper hand and shoots Burton after Estevez is killed. With precision, Michael loads rifle bags into the squad car and speeds away as darkness envelops the city. Meanwhile, Jeep awakens from a dream, sweating in his cramped bedroom. He steps outside on a cool morning, glancing at a diner with a glowing sign. He exchanges a poignant moment with Charlie, a pregnant girl, who sees his struggle. Although touched by his sweetness, they share differing emotions. Bob Hansen, the diner owner, tries to fix an old TV.
